N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8195-2.1 - Request for State advisory appraisal

State Regulations
(a) The request for a State advisory
appraisal shall be in writing and shall be filed with ORPTS by the chief
executive officer or assessor of a city or town or of a county with the power
to assess real property. A request for a State advisory appraisal must be
received at least 12 months in advance of taxable status date and will not be
deemed to have been made until all information required by these rules, or
otherwise requested by ORPTS, is supplied to ORPTS. No additional request is
necessary if the assessing unit is implementing a reassessment in conformance
with a local plan pursuant to section 8201-2.5 of this Title and used that
advisory appraisal on the prior year assessment roll. (b) Forms. The request for a State advisory
appraisal shall be made on a form provided by ORPTS. Notes
